content:
Hi. As I was using zulip today, I had a question to ask but didn't know which stream to ask it in. So I wanted to look through the descriptions of all the streams in my left sidebar and see which one would be appropriate. However, I found myself dissatisfied with the amount of effort needed to discover the purpose of a stream.

Currently, I have to open up the stream settings in order to see what a stream is about. Not only is this one click too many for me, but it is not very intuitive in my mind.

I searched the chat and found #8707 (put the stream description in the stream popover), which I think would be a great step in the right direction; however, as Tim pointed out, this would be problematic for longer descriptions.

What I would like to see is something along the lines of what Slack does with the "channel topic". Whenever you are viewing a channel, the channel topic is displayed at the top.

Screen-Shot-2018-04-09-at-1.48.01-PM.png

I'd like to hear people's thoughts on this.

In fact, I think there might be opportunity here for a sort of "stream info" header at the top. Bits of information that might be nice to include:

  • How many people have participated (or are active participants / subscribers / something) in this stream
  • How many topics are in the stream
  • Hot button for quick mute/unmute
  • Stream description
I think it's agreed we should do something along those lines, though we're a bit stuck on the details.
Rocket.Chat has a button to expand / contract the left column, to toggle showing / hiding of channel descriptions and other info
@Strypey interesting! Could you take a screenshot, if you have a rocket.chat instance handy?

Info button in the top bar.
Screen-Shot-2018-04-11-at-1.27.45-PM.png Screen-Shot-2018-04-11-at-1.27.56-PM.png
Also they have loading screen in the starting, which is shown until all is settled in the background.
where is the button to expand/contract the left column? (edit: oh, OP means right column)

I was imagining something different, which is going from

to

in the left sidebar.
